globalShortcuts.notes: The whitelist of allowed APIs for Clean Core.

notes.title: Cash Position Check
notes.content:
"Show my current cash position for [entity/company code] and flag any liquidity concerns for the next [time period]."

Example: "Show my current cash position for Company Code 1000 and flag any liquidity concerns for the next 30 days based on open AR, AP, and scheduled payments."

notes.title: Collections Prioritization
notes.content:
"List customers with overdue receivables > [threshold] days and highest credit risk. Propose prioritized collection actions for top [number] accounts."

Example: "List customers with overdue receivables > 60 days and highest credit risk based on payment history. Propose prioritized collection actions and draft email templates for top 10 accounts."

notes.title: Period-End Close Analysis
notes.content:
"Analyze period-end close for [scope] for [period]: 1) Summarize P&L with top 5 variances vs budget by cost center, 2) Explain variance drivers in business language, 3) Identify reconciliation items blocking close, 4) Recommend corrective actions for next period."

Example: "Analyze period-end close for Company Code 1000 for March 2025: 1) Summarize P&L with top 5 variances vs budget >10% by cost center, 2) Explain drivers (volume, price, timing), 3) Identify top 20 GR/IR clearing items blocking close with resolution steps, 4) Recommend 3 process improvements to accelerate next close by 1 day."

notes.title: Margin Optimization
notes.content:
"For materials with negative margin in last [period], combine finance and supply chain data: 1) Show purchase prices, selling prices, stock levels, and demand forecast, 2) Identify root causes (pricing, cost inflation, volume drop), 3) Calculate margin improvement scenarios (price increase, cost reduction, product mix), 4) Propose specific actions with expected margin improvement."

Example: "For materials with negative margin in last 3 months, combine finance and supply chain data: 1) Show purchase prices, selling prices, current stock levels, and 90-day demand forecast, 2) Identify root causes by product line, 3) Calculate 3 scenarios (5% price increase, 10% cost reduction, optimize product mix), 4) Propose top 5 actions with expected margin improvement from -2% to +3%."

notes.title: S/4HANA FUE Ratios
notes.content:
S/4HANA Cloud User License Ratios:

1 Advanced User = 1 FUE
5 Core Users = 1 FUE
30 Self-Service Users = 1 FUE
Developer = 1 FUE (Always)

What Each Type Means:
• Advanced User - Full access to all transactions
• Core User - Limited to specific business processes
• Self-Service User - Basic read/write (e.g., expense reports)
• Developer - Full development and customization access

Example Calculation:
50 Advanced + 200 Core + 600 Self-Service + 10 Developers
= 50 + 40 + 20 + 10
= 120 FUE total

Key for Sizing Projects:
Always calculate FUE during discovery to size licenses correctly.
